intro: Cyrtandra puberis, commonly known as the hairy cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Cyrtandra puberis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural studies.
